title: Bad experience
text: Despite informing them about the traffic jam, they still charged me for the order I couldn't pick up. It's frustrating to be penalized for circumstances beyond our control. Customer service was unhelpful and unresponsive, adding to the overall negative experience.

title: Fava Pot
text:
Made rice and pasta so very delicious with their spices, and grilled onions just elevated the dish.  
Loved the roasted potatoes with their spices and olive oil.

title: It's a mixed bag
text: Some places you'll get a ton good of food worth the price. Other times you'll pay $6 for 2-3 old slices of pizza or a couple stale bagels. Overall I've had good experiences I just know to go in with low expectations

title: Great app terrible businesses associated
text: I think the app is truly a great concept and it can definitely help both businesses and consumers. However in my experience using the app some businesses are essentially using the service to turn trash into profit rather than potential waste into a decent meal. Prices vary based on business some businesses charge $10 for literal scraps. There needs to be some sort of quality control or some sort of requirement. I shouldn‚Äôt have to toss out the food they give because it‚Äôs just inedible. We should be able to leave visible reviews on the restaurants we ordered from so there‚Äôs more transparency. After having 2 bad experiences in a row I cannot be the only one feeling like with the popularity of the app abuse is inevitable. If a visible review is shared on the app I think it would keep businesses more honest and prevent a bit of nonsense. I don‚Äôt expect the best of the best or an over abundance but I definitely don‚Äôt want to pay $5-10 then come home and throw away inedible food.

title: Surprise box
text: Everything was so good and the guy was so nice when I went in with my granddaughter. I will definitely go back

title: Store was closed during my pick up time
text: Loved the idea of this app. Placed my first order for my surprise bag and my pick up time was set for 1:30 - 2:30. I arrived at the store at 2:20 but the restaurant had closed at 2pm and all the doors were locked. Very disappointed that I got out only to have wasted my time and gas and now might not see a return for up to 14 days. Definitely need to work on their communication with their associated restaurants!

title: Charged after reporting issue of nothing to save at pick up
text: Contacted support because the place I went for pick again didn‚Äôt have anything. Reach out to report no food. Then was charged 4.99 for an order I never got. Bot response to contact message explain that the restaurant should have said there was no food. I want a refund. Still waiting on response. Contact my bank and canceling the app. Too many bad experiences at this point. Get better support or better contact between app and restaurant l.

title: Brilliant App
text: This app is just so innovative and amazing. Love being able to purchase affordable food and know i‚Äôm doing a good deed by creating less food waste!! this app is amazing !!!!!!!!!!!!

title: I Love This App
text: I use this app a lot recently while I am a student in France and it is a Godsend. So much food for a low price and I haven't had a bad experience yet. Stop food waste!

title: Great app
text: Wish we could see review feedback not just the review rating. Also wish there could be alerts on when certain bags are dropped and maybe a limit on how many one person can get?

title: Win win

title: Love what you do!
text: So far I have really enjoyed the app and the deals out there. I know for a fact that many of the restaurants out there throw away food rather than make the effort to sell it at a discount price. What you‚Äôre doing is exactly what needs to be done. I hate paying full price and I have no problem getting food at the end of the day or one day later. Same thing that happens at my house on a daily occurrence, right? The people who want to buy it, and it helps the restaurants willing to sell it! It‚Äôs a win-win!

title: App has been glitching like crazy
text: I used the app a couple times and it worked fine, then all of a sudden a couple weeks ago, the search function completely stopped working, and the nearby results don't change from what's around my apartment no matter where I go or where I change it to. It's 100% unusable.

title: Fun and a great value!
text: This is a great way to try neighborhood places you may not know, and for a fraction of the cost. A really nice way to supplement lunches or breakfasts!

title: Hit or Miss, but great fun!
text: The restaurants are hit or miss, but it‚Äôs a great way to try out new restaurants and bakeries (lots of bakeries!) for minimal cost. I already found some new favorite places. However, the app needs to offer an easy function for restaurants to refund customers when they don‚Äôt have anything available, instead of making customers show up and not get anything and then have to contact support to get a refund.

title: OBSESSED
text: Absolutely love this app. The idea of food waste truly haunts me and we see all those photos of famous brands throwing out hundreds of perfectly edible products. Too good to go helps lower the impact of food waste AND allows you to get delicious fresh goods for a significantly lower price!! It‚Äôs amazing, try it for sure.

title: Questionable value
text: I imagine this concept will become a phenomenon over the next few years, and I am all for it. Quality and quantity varies. Most merchants are not providing the value listed, but closer to the value paid. I really hope that will change because I have felt cheated more than once. Other times, restaurants have been inconsistent. It‚Äôs a big reflection on the app, and I‚Äôm hoping the issue will be dealt with before I purchase another meal.

title: missed order
text: it's okay but if you missed the time to pick up the order, they will not refund you or let you pick it up another day. luckily i was able to call the store about my situation and they were able to give me my order. it's a weird policy to only be able to cancel an order two hours before when anything can happen that can cause you to miss that two hour mark to cancel. when you do miss the time slot they refuse to refund due to their terms and conditions so you can potentially loose your money for no reason. if you buy from here just set an alarm and if you got into an accident or something else happen that cause you to miss it. don't bother contacting customer service because they do nothing but yap and just call the store itself or just call your bank to dispute transaction.

title: Great
text: Really great value for amazing food I paid 27 dollars for a to go plate that weighs 3 pounds and on too good to go I got the same weight for 5.99. They weigh it by the pound with the to go plates and it is 7.99 a pound so it is a great value

title: Helpful and useful!
text:
So this app has actually been really cool. I highly encourage y‚Äôall to check it out. It‚Äôs basically local restaurants and smaller grocery stores putting together surprise bags of their food for super cheap. It can be hit or miss if you‚Äôre a super picky eater but otherwise it‚Äôs a fantastic deal and helps cut down on food waste. I‚Äôve gotten a lot of use out of it in DFW.

Edit after using it for a while. 

This app has still been extremely helpful and most definitely holds its value as far as I an concerned. Especially for people like me who enjoy Indian food and Tiff‚Äôs treats leftovers!

title: More choices
text: Need more vendors.

title: Inflation destroying your wallet? Solution to takeout.
text: For five or six bucks you get to have your meals prepared for the next two days if you spaced them out properly. if you have an aversion to cooking or simply want to help make a different climate wise, while getting delicious food, the solution right here is perfect.

title: First time using too good to go was a great experience!
text: I was so excited about getting a mystery box from Mr moto pizza. It was fast and easy. The staff was very friendly and the mystery box handoff did not disappoint. I‚Äôm definitely going to do this again.

title: Not enough detail
text:
Due to the in-app review system you're left guessing if a place is worth it. All you can deduce is that if the restaurant isn't highlighted as "great value" then it's probably not worth visiting. If it's not 4.5 stars or ideally even higher it's likely not worth it but there's no other info to go on.

I like the overall concept, but it feels a bit greenwashed. If food waste was a bigger goal overall prices would be lower for day old bread. You have to think of it as a help to the small business to feel justified.

Additionally, it's got to be almost impossible if you have food allergies.

title: Needs captcha
text: Needs some kind of captcha or human verification.  Too many ppl using bots.  See ppl raffling off bags online because the same person gets them every night and controls the market
